qas.question: What private university is located in downtown New Haven?
What community college is located in downtown New Haven?
What state university is located in New Haven?
What school serves as the largest employer of New Haven?
In what year did Gateway Community College open its newly consolidated downtown campus?
What the name of a state university also located in the city?
Other than Yale, New Haven has another private college in the city, it's name?
Before relocating to downtown area, New Haven has a community college that used to be located where?
When was the new Gateway Community College open?

context: New Haven is a notable center for higher education. <a0_0><a3_0>Yale University<a3_0/><a0_0/>, at the <a5_0>heart of downtown<a5_0/>, is one of the city's best known features and its largest employer. New Haven is also home to <a2_0><a6_0>Southern Connecticut State University<a6_0/><a2_0/>, part of the Connecticut State University System, and <a7_0>Albertus Magnus College<a7_0/>, a private institution. <a1_0>Gateway Community College<a1_0/> has a campus in downtown New Haven, formerly located in the <a8_0>Long Wharf district<a8_0/>; Gateway consolidated into one campus downtown into a new state-of-the-art campus (on the site of the old Macy's building) and was open for the <a9_0>Fall <a4_0>2012<a9_0/><a4_0/> semester.
